alert.note: Alert for Shelby; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 3:41AM CDT until March 27 at 7:14PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bibb, Shelby and Talladega. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alabaster, Sylacauga, Calera, Montevallo, Childersburg, Columbiana, Centreville, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Vance, West Blocton, Wilton, Oak Grove, Bon Air, Shelby County Airport, American Village, University Of Montevallo, Lay Lake, Fayetteville and Eoline.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
